edu.umaryland.igs.idea
Class BooleanParameter

java.lang.Object
  edu.umaryland.igs.idea.Parameter
      edu.umaryland.igs.idea.MultipleChoiceParameter
          edu.umaryland.igs.idea.BooleanParameter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class BooleanParameter
extends MultipleChoiceParameter

BooleanParameter represents an IDEA parameter which allows the user to choose one of two options (not necessarily true and false). This is a convenience extension of MultipleChoiceParameter. If the buttons are laid out horizontally, the parameter name is displayed above the buttons; if the buttons are laid out vertically, the parameter name is not displayed. Therefore, a BooleanParameter always takes up two display rows.

Written:

Copyright (C) 2006, Amy Egan and Joana C. Silva.

All rights reserved.

Author:
Amy Egan

Constructor Detail

BooleanParameter

public BooleanParameter(String n,
                        Object v,
                        ParameterExplanation e)
This constructor creates a BooleanParameter with horizontally arranged radio buttons labeled "Yes" and "No". It calls the superclass constructor.

Parameters:
n - the parameter name
v - the parameter value
e - the parameter explanation

BooleanParameter

public BooleanParameter(String n,
                        Object v,
                        ParameterExplanation e,
                        String c1,
                        String c2)
This constructor creates a BooleanParameter with horizontally arranged radio buttons. The fourth and fifth parameters are used as the names of the options.

Parameters:
n - the parameter name
v - the parameter value
e - the parameter explanation
c1 - the name of the first choice (as shown to the user)
c2 - the name of the second choice (as shown to the user)

BooleanParameter

public BooleanParameter(String n,
                        Object v,
                        ParameterExplanation e,
                        String c1,
                        String c2,
                        boolean vertical)
This constructor creates a BooleanParameter with the given name, value, explanation and choices c1 and c2. The vertical parameter controls whether the radio buttons are arranged vertically or horizontally.

Parameters:
n - the parameter name
v - the parameter value
e - the parameter explanation
c1 - the name of the first choice (as shown to the user)
c2 - the name of the second choice (as shown to the user)
vertical - whether to arrange the radio buttons vertically (true) or horizontally (false)

boxIntoArray

private static String[] boxIntoArray(String s1,
                                     String s2)

updateValue

public void updateValue(Object newValue)
The updateValue method is called whenever the parameter's value is changed for some reason other than user input. For example, changing the value of one parameter may automatically change the value of another parameter. This method extends the Parameter method to select the appropriate radio button.

Overrides:
updateValue in class MultipleChoiceParameter
Parameters:
newValue - the new value for this parameter

readObject

private void readObject(ObjectInputStream in)
                 throws IOException,
                        ClassNotFoundException
The readObject method has the exact signature required for Java serialization, although serialization is actually performed using the third-party XStream library. Parameters require custom serialization because the action and focus listeners which update their values based on user input to the GUI are not fields of the objects they listen on and thus are not automatically restored during deserialization, so they must be restored explicitly to ensure that parameter changes the user makes after loading a saved configuration are honored. Since the addActionListener method modifies the actionListeners field, a copy must be used here to avoid a ConcurrentModificationException. After adding the listeners to the GUI components using addActionListener, the actionListeners parameter is reset to the copy so it will not contain duplicates. NOTE: This method is identical for class Parameter and all its subclasses, but because it is required to be private, it has been copied into each subclass.

Parameters:
in - the input stream from which to read this parameter
Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs during deserialization
ClassNotFoundException - if a class in the hierarchy of the deserialized parameter is unrecognized
